title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ખાનદેશ બુરાનપુરમાં, વસે હરિજન જેહ<RHYME_208411>; 
સહાય કરી જેની સ્વામીએ, કહું સાંભળજ્યો હવે તેહ<RHYME_208411>.
gujarati.context: In a country troubled by poverty and inequality, the oppressed Harijan lives; I pray to my Lord for help, asking Him to intervene now.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વિપ્ર એક દિવાન દાદો, સતસંગી નહિ સોય<RHYME_208412>; 
જાણ્યે અજાણ્યે જમાડિયા, સંત તે સ્વામીના દોય<RHYME_208412>.
gujarati.context: A wise sage is like a distant ancestor, not to be joined in worldly pursuits; only the self-realized soul can fully comprehend and attain the ultimate goal.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બીજાં પુણ્ય તો બહુ કર્યાં, જન્મ ધરીને જેહ<RHYME_208411>; 
તેહ ભેળું પુણ્ય આટલું, થયું અજાણ્યે એહ<RHYME_208411>.
gujarati.context: The soul's past karma is fully spent, and it has taken birth anew; but even so, it will continue to accumulate more karma, without knowing when its time will end.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં અવધિ તેનો, આવ્યો તે દેહનો અંત<RHYME_208414>; 
અવશ્ય તેડવા આવિયા, મહા કરૂર તે કૃતાંત<RHYME_208414>.
gujarati.context: As one's life force departs, so too does the body's end; inevitably, the consequences of one's actions catch up with them.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
અંતકાળે આવ્યા જમ જ્યારે, દીધું દાદાને દુઃખ તે વારે; 
જે જે જન્મ ધરી કર્યાં પાપ<RHYME_208416>, તે તે સંભારી કર્યો સંતાપ<RHYME_208416>.
gujarati.context: At the end of time, when I have to face my grandfather's sorrow, I will be punished for all the wrongs I committed in this life. The consequences of my past misdeeds will come back to haunt me.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
દીઠા દાદે જમદૂત જ્યારે, દેવી દેવને સંભાર્યા ત્યારે; 
સંત મહંત સંન્યાસી સોય<RHYME_208412>, તેહ વિના જે સેવ્યાતા કોય<RHYME_208412>.
gujarati.context: When the godly couple is united, saints and sages renounce worldly attachments; they serve only for the sake of service, without personal gain.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ સર્વેને જોયા સંભારી, કહ્યું કોઈ હરો પીડા મારી; 
એહ માંહિલું એકે ન આવ્યું, તે વારે દાદે શીશ ડોલાવ્યું.
gujarati.context: All my sufferings were known to everyone, I said no one would take away my pain; My father-in-law's war will make my hair turn gray with worry.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે હવે કરું હું શીપેર્ય, કેણે સાય ન કરી આ વેર; 
એમ કહીને થયો નિરાશ, ત્યાં તો સંત દીઠા દોય પાસ.
gujarati.context:
I will wait patiently and not take the initiative; 
The moment I gave up, my hopes were shattered like a broken pot.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે સંત સુણો જમદૂત<RHYME_208419>, કેમ આવિયા આંહીં કપુત<RHYME_208419>; 
જાઓ વેલા વેલા પાછા વળી, કેમ ઊભા રહ્યા છો સાંભળી.
gujarati.context: The saint asks the sinner why they are stuck in this world, having come from a distant place; and says that if you are so worried about your past, then get out of it and don't stay stuck.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બોલિયા જમના દૂત<RHYME_208421>, ઠાલું શીદને કરો છો તુત<RHYME_208421>; 
એહ જીવ કેદિ છે તમારો, સર્વે રીત્યે એ છે જો અમારો.
gujarati.context: When the time is right, speak up like a messenger of fate; This life is your prison, and our ways are just as yours.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે જોર તમારે ન કરવું, જાઓ યાંથી આડું નવ્ય ફરવું; 
એવો સંત ને જમનો વાદ<RHYME_208424>, સુણે છે દાદો સર્વે સંવાદ<RHYME_208424>.
gujarati.context: Don't force your will on others, and instead move forward with a new approach; even the wise elders agree that silence is golden when it comes to wisdom.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે સંત કહે જાશું અમે, લેઈ જાઓ જો લેવાય તમે; 
ત્યારે જમ કહે જોડી હાથ<RHYME_208426>, તમે સુખે ચાલો અમ સાથ<RHYME_208426>.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that when the time is right, take what's offered and go with it, as long as it's meant for you; otherwise, walk together in joy with those who share your path.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જાઈયે ધર્મરાયને જો પાસ<RHYME_208427>, જ્યાં છે પાપ પુણ્યનો તપાસ<RHYME_208427>; 
એનાં જોશે સકૃત સંભાળી, હશે તમારા તો દેશે વાળી.
gujarati.context: If someone seeks the path of righteousness where sin and merit are weighed; they will find their own salvation and be separated from your land.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહી કાઢ્યો જીવ જ્યારે, થઈ સતી તેની નારી ત્યારે; 
તેનો જીવ આવી સંગે મળ્યો, નારી સહિત જમપુર પળ્યો.
gujarati.context: When the soul was separated from the body, its wife went with it; together they reached Jam Puri.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ચાલ્યા સંત જમદૂત સાથ<RHYME_208426>, ગયા જિયાં હતા જમનાથ<RHYME_208426>; 
ધર્મે સંતનું સન્માન કીધું, પછી એ જીવનું ખત લીધું.
gujarati.context: Saint Jamdutt left with his devotees, having spent a joyful life in devotion; after that, he was honored by the faith, and his mortal life came to an end.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
નહિ પુણ્ય ને પાપ અનંત<RHYME_208431>, પુણ્ય એટલું જમ્યા બે સંત<RHYME_208431>; 
કરી તેહ પુણ્યનો તપાસ<RHYME_208427>, કહે ધર્મ જાઓ હરિ પાસ<RHYME_208427>.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that one's good deeds are countless, but can be lost if not sought after; instead, seek God and leave worldly pursuits behind.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી મહારાજ પાસળે લાવ્યા, સંત દોય તેહ સંગે આવ્યા; 
ત્યારે મહારાજ કહે સુણો જન<RHYME_208433>, એણે આપ્યું છે તમને અન્ન<RHYME_208433>.
gujarati.context: The king summoned the saints to his palace and they came together with him; then the king said, "Know this, dear one, that you have been given bread by me."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે હમણાં સુરપુર જાશે, પછી વૈકુંઠનો વાસ થાશે; 
એમ કહી આપ્યા દોય હાર, પહેરી ચાલ્યાં પુરુષ ને નાર્ય.
gujarati.context: One will suffer on earth, and then attain the abode of heaven. This is what I say, do not forget, even great men like you must eventually succumb to fate.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે દીઠું સર્વે સમાધિવાને, વળી જે કહ્યું તે સુણ્યું કાને; 
જાગ્યા સમાધિ માંહિથી જ્યારે, આવી સર્વે કહી વાત ત્યારે.
gujarati.context: When the mind is at peace and focused, what I have thought will be heard in my ear. In a state of deep meditation, everything that I want to say will come out at that time.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે આજ થકી નવ વરષે, દાદો સતસંગમાં દેહ ધરશે; 
થાશે સતસંગી નારી ને નર<RHYME_208437>, પછી જાશે તે બ્રહ્મનગર<RHYME_208437>.
gujarati.context: Today's body will be absorbed in the company of elders next year; after that, it will merge with Brahman, guided by the wise woman and man.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એ તો દીઠું છે અમારે નેણ<RHYME_208438>, નથી જૂઠું એમાં એકે વેણ<RHYME_208438>; 
સહુ સાંભળી આશ્ચર્ય પામ્યાં, થયો પરચો કહી શીશ નામ્યાં.
gujarati.context: This couplet says that what is spoken truthfully is a blessing, and not to be found fault with it; even if one's mind is filled with wonder and astonishment.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી વણિક ભક્ત સુંદર<RHYME_208440>, ભાઈ શામજી ને પીતાંબર<RHYME_208440>; 
એહ બેઉ ભાઈ સતસંગી, તેનો ભાઈ વૈષ્ણવ કુસંગી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Beautiful in appearance, Shri Bhagat has the beauty of a merchant, and his brother Shamji is like a puffed up peacock; these two brothers are companions in spiritual pursuits, with Shamji being a devotee of Lord Vishnu.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
નામ શોભારામ તે અનાડી, કરે સતસંગનો દ્રોહ દાડી; 
શામજી પીતાંબરને વારે, આવે સતસંગ માંહિ તો મારે.
gujarati.context: A person with a beautiful name is like an untamed serpent, destroying good company; one's own company is sufficient for them even if others are present.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરે અવળાઈ અતિ, કેનું કેણ ન માને કુમતિ; 
કરે નિંદા એ પડ્યો અભ્યાસ<RHYME_208427>, પછી આવ્યા તે સંતને પાસ<RHYME_208427>.
gujarati.context: One who is humble and unassuming can gain the trust of others; through practice, even a sinner can become pure and reach God's grace.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સંતે વાત કરી અતિ સારી, તે તો વાત હૈયામાં ન ધારી; 
પછી સંતને રૂપે શ્રીમુખ<RHYME_208445>, કહ્યાં જમપુરીનાં જે દુઃખ<RHYME_208445>.
gujarati.context: A saint's words are always sweet and pure, but only those who understand can truly grasp their meaning. Afterward, the saint's face glows with divine beauty, filled with the sorrow of Jamnapuri's duhk (suffering).
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સુણી તરત થઈ ત્યાં સમાધિ, જઈ દીઠી જમપુરી બાધી; 
ઠામો ઠામથી ઉઠિયા જમ<RHYME_208446>, દેવા લાગ્યા છે માર વિષમ<RHYME_208446>.
gujarati.context: In a state of calm and peace, I've found my ultimate serenity; yet, my worries still linger, like a constant nagging thought.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ મારે બોલે મુખ એમ<RHYME_208447>, પાપી સતસંગીને પીડે કેમ<RHYME_208447>; 
તેનું ફળ સર્વે તને દેશું, તારો મારી મારી જીવ લેશું.
gujarati.context: The wicked will suffer at the hands of those they wrong, and their deeds will ultimately bring them harm. Their fate will be sealed, and I'll take away their life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ દીધો દંડ ઘડી ચાર<RHYME_208449>, પછી આવ્યો સમાધિથી બાર<RHYME_208449>; 
આવી કહી સંત આગે વાત<RHYME_208450>, આજ થઈતી જીવની ઘાત<RHYME_208450>.
gujarati.context: After a harsh criticism, I received a gentle rebuke; today's pain is the hurt of my own life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હવે જ્યાં લગી રહે મારા પ્રાણ<RHYME_208451>, ન કરું સતસંગનાં કુવખાણ<RHYME_208451>; 
ત્યારે સંત કહે સારું ભાઈ, હવે બેસ તું સમાધિ માંઇ.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બેઠો ધ્યાને શોભારામ<RHYME_208452>, દીઠા હરિ ને હરિનાં ધામ<RHYME_208452>; 
પામ્યા સુખ સમાધિમાં અતિ, જોઈ સ્વામીશ્રીજીની મૂરતિ.
gujarati.context: After sitting in contemplation, one experiences great joy and spiritual bliss; it is as if the soul has merged with its true nature.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
રહ્યો પ્રભુ પાસે બહુવાર<RHYME_208449>, પછી આવ્યો સમાધિથી બાર<RHYME_208449>; 
આવી કહી છે સર્વે વાત<RHYME_208450>, કહે સ્વામી મેં નીરખ્યા સાક્ષાત<RHYME_208450>.
gujarati.context: I stayed at God's door for a long time, and then I came back to my true self.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આવું ન દીઠું ને ન સાંભળ્યું, અતિ મોટું સુખ મને મળ્યું; 
હું તો પામિયો આનંદ અંગ<RHYME_208454>, કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય સતસંગ<RHYME_208454>.
gujarati.context: I never expected nor prepared for such immense joy to come my way; I've received it as a blessing from the company of good people.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હું તો પામિયો પરચો આજ<RHYME_208455>, મને મળ્યા પ્રકટ મહારાજ<RHYME_208455>; 
વળી બુરાનપુરને માંઇ<RHYME_208456>, રહે દ્વિજ નારાયણજી ત્યાંઇ<RHYME_208456>.
gujarati.context: Today I've got the darshan of Maharaj, my mind has found peace; In Varnapur, Narayanji resides there.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 152: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે તો આવ્યો તો ઉદ્યમ કાજ<RHYME_208457>, ગુજરધર માંહિ દ્વિજરાજ<RHYME_208457>; 
તિયાં મળી ગયો સતસંગ<RHYME_208454>, ધાર્યાં નિયમ સર્વે શુભ અંગ<RHYME_208454>.

transliteration.context: As my life force is dwindling, I won't indulge in worldly conversations; instead, I'll focus on spiritual talks with the saints. In this state of detachment, I've achieved inner peace and self-realization.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī beṭho dhyāne Shobhārām, dīṭhā Hari ne Harinā dhām; <RHYME_30>
Pāmyā sukh samādhimā ati, joī Swāmī-Shrījīnī mūrati.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a peaceful and meditative state where one's thoughts are absorbed in God (Hari) and the soul resides in the divine abode. In this tranquil state, one experiences great joy and self-realization.

transliteration.couplet:
Rahyo Prabhu pāse bahuvār, pachhī āvyo samādhithī bār; <RHYME_31>
Āvī kahī chhe sarve vāt, kahe Swāmī me nīrakhyā sākṣhāt.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: Many trials come and go in front of the Lord, but I stand firm in my spiritual resolve; Every situation is like a witness testifying to my devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvu na dīṭhu ne na sāmbhaḷyu, ati moṭu sukh mane maḷyu; <RHYME_32>
Hu to pāmiyo ānand ang, kahe dhanya dhanya satasang.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: You are blessed with peace and happiness that is difficult to find elsewhere, for it brings great joy to your life. In the company of good people, I too feel happy and grateful.

transliteration.couplet:
Hu to pāmiyo paracho āj, mane maḷyā prakaṭ Mahārāj; <RHYME_33>
Vaḷī Burānpurne māi, rahe dvij Nārāyaṇjī tyāi.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context:
Today I met Mahārāj in my mind's eye, and my heart is filled with devotion; 
Vaḷī Burānpurne's mother, my soul remains connected to Lord Nārāyaṇ.

transliteration.couplet:
Te to āvyo to udyam kāj, Gujardhar māhi dvijrāj; <RHYME_34>
Tiyā maḷī gayo satasang, dhāryā niyam sarve shubh ang.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context:
A person should strive to achieve their goals and ambitions (udyam kāj), just like the king of fish (Gujardhar māhi) rules over the sea.

In a gathering of noble people (satasang), one should maintain good behavior (shubh ang) following moral codes (niyam).

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī gayā thoḍā ghaṇā dan, āvī avadhiye tyāgiyu tan; <RHYME_35>
Tyāre teḍavā āvyā Mahārāj, gayo Brahmamole dvijrāj.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: When a soul departs, the body remains in decay, but the self returns to God; The Lord's mercy is immense, and all souls are equal before Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Teno sut Harirām ek, hato ghare nānakaḍo chhek; <RHYME_36>
Tene paṇ thayo satasang, thaī samādhi palaṭyu ang.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: One man's virtue is worth a thousand, if not in the home then nowhere else. Even if I get one hundred virtues elsewhere, they are useless without spiritual connection at home.

transliteration.couplet:
Gayo deh tajī Brahmamohol, tiyā dīṭhu chhe sukh atol; <RHYME_37>
Dīṭhā tyānā sarve rahenār, dīṭho potāno tāt te vār.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The soul merges with the divine to attain eternal bliss, and all worries cease. In this state of union, all troubles remain far away, like the distant past.

transliteration.couplet:
Tāt sut maḷyā māhomāī, evu dīṭhu chhe samādhi māi; <RHYME_38>
Jyāre āvyo samādhithī bār, eh vāt karī chhe te vār.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: In this state of deep devotion, I am one with my beloved. With each breath, our union becomes stronger and more profound.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangīe mānyu te satya, kahe kusangī sarve asatya; <RHYME_39>
Ame na mānīe evī vāṇya, māniye jyāre maḷe endhāṇ.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: Truth is what one accepts with sincerity, and all else is falsehood. One should not accept anything without verifying its authenticity, especially in matters of the heart.

transliteration.couplet:
Vāru samādhi māhi tu jaī, pūchhiye vāt te āvya laī; <RHYME_40>
Tāro tāt ne ame be bhāī, gayātā bījā gāmaḍā māi.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The soul merges with the divine, asking for a breath to return; the heart's threads are cut, like seeds that have lost their way.

transliteration.couplet:
Shiye kāme gayātā tyā shu thayu, kahejye jaī mane e pūchhiyu; <RHYME_41>
Pachhī Harirāme samādhi karī, gayo Brahmamohol māhi farī.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the process of a devotee's soul leaving their physical body to reunite with God, as seen in the example of Harirama who achieved spiritual absorption.

transliteration.couplet:
Nārāyaṇjī je eno tāt, tene āgaḷya jaī kahī vāt; <RHYME_42>
Mitra tamāro Vyankaṭrām, teno bhāī Gnāneshvar nām.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes Lord Narayana's devotee who is like a tree that withstands fierce winds; he is the friend of Mitra, the lord of knowledge and wisdom.

transliteration.couplet:
Teṇe pūchhyu chhe prashna te em, ame gyātā bīje gām kem; <RHYME_43>
Tyāre Nārāyaṇ kahe tāt, tenī kahu tane sarve vāt.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The speaker asks about the purpose of questioning oneself, as if they have already understood the answer; meanwhile, Narayana's words are like a gentle breeze that reaches everyone's soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Gām nāme Badalpur māi, gyātā ponk khāvā sāru tyāī; <RHYME_44>
Ponk khāī pāchhā ame vaḷyā, tyāre vāṭ māhi bhīl maḷyā.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a farm in Badalpur where sugarcane is harvested and stored in large containers. The farmer's joy is short-lived as the stored sugarcane quickly rots, leaving him with nothing but regret.

transliteration.couplet:
Teṇe vastra līdhā sarve lūnṭī, dejye endhāṇīe jaī moṭī; <RHYME_45>
Pachhī samādhithī āvī bār, karī vāt e sarve te vār.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: When the wind blows away everyone's garments, I remain naked and humble; later, it will settle back to its place, but not before blowing over all my troubles too.

transliteration.couplet:
Je je vītī e traṇne vāt, kahī endhāṇī daīne sākṣhāt; <RHYME_46>
Tyāre Vyankaṭrāme vichāryu, satya vāt em man dhāryu.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: As the wind blows and time passes, truth is revealed in its wake; one should seek knowledge with an open heart and mind.

transliteration.couplet:
Gnāneshvar rahyo gam khāy, ā vāt kem khoṭī kahevāy; <RHYME_47>
Sāchā satasangī sāchā sant, sāchā Swāmī pote Bhagwant.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: A true devotee remains in the world but does not get tainted by worldly desires, and a true guru is one who reveals the ultimate truth. A true saint, true friend, and true Lord are all ultimately one with God.

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahī sant pāy namyā, karajyo Mahārāj am par kṣhamā; <RHYME_48>
Tamārī sarve sāchī chhe vāt, ame pāmyā paracho sākṣhāt.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: The saint's true name is found in the Lord's forgiveness, and all his virtues are witnessed by His mercy. One's entire truth is revealed only when they surrender to God's witness.

transliteration.couplet:
Em bahu bahu chamatkār, thāy Burānpur mozār; <RHYME_49>
Kahetā lakhatā na āve ant, em parchā thāy chhe atyant.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The extraordinary wonders of the world's beauty are akin to the magnificent monuments in Burhanpur; just as one cannot exhaust the limits of a sweet thing, so too is the extreme sweetness that I have.

transliteration.couplet:
Paḷe paḷe kare Hari sahāy, nitya pratye satasang māy; <RHYME_50>
Teṇe magan rahe nar-nār, kahe Niṣhkuḷānand niradhār.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: Lord Hari is always present to help me, and I am blessed to have constant companionship with Him. In His divine play, I remain forever young and carefree like a child.
